verses.roman:
aiche mahāprabhura līlā--nāhi ora-pāra
'jīva' hañā kebā samyak pāre varṇibāra?

synonyms: aiche—similarly; mahāprabhura līlā—the pastimes of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; nāhi ora-pāra—there is no limit above or below; jīva hañā—being an ordinary living entity; kebā—who; samyak—fully; pāre—is able; varṇibāra—to describe.
translation: The pastimes of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu are like the unlimited sky. How, then, can an ordinary living being describe them all?
